TopicTitle: What would be your plans if you had a trillion dollars?

Articles.Content:
There's a catch, though, and that is that you cannot use the money in any way that influences you directly.

And by that I mean that you can't list things like '1) Buy mansion, 2) Yacht, 3) Roadster, etc.

You can list things or come up with something that will indirectly affect you though. So if you want to start an aerospace company, then that's entirely possible, with the one rule that any money you make can't be used for you personally, even if the advancement of space exploration affects you indirectly.

That sort of thing.

Spoiler

Personally, I would go all this:

The towers can cost anywhere from 25 to 100 million dollars to construct, depending on the structure itself and what additional security, scientists and personnel in general would be in it.

Basically, the idea would be to start a private company focused on agriculture and higher level education. The plan would be to set up vertical farms in very poor regions of Africa (e.g, Malawi) that are constantly getting hit with droughts and famine, and that will continue to suffer as climate change progresses. Most of these areas feature heavy deforestation as well, and the land is not always the most suitable for farming.

The private company would build the towers in the middle of these areas, and would staff them with a force of teachers, scientists, engineers, and, unfortunately, armed security, since, well.... Towers full of food may be prone to looting of a sort.

The people in the tower would all be payed 'employees,' chosen for having a certain, philanthropic attitude, and would help establish schools in the regions surrounding the tower. The tower would, in time, become a hub of education, where locals would be taught useful skills, educated in general, and eventually instructed on how to operate the vertical farms.

Eventually, the private employees would no longer be needed, and when withdrawn, they would (ideally) leave behind a more educated populace with consistent school funding and a rising generation of engineers and scientists - essentially, kids with opportunity. The vertical farm would provide food security, and the schools would provide the knowledge to keep the operation running.

Obviously, there's a crap ton of things that would have to be sorted out before embarking on an operation of this size (politics and economics, particularly), but somewhere out there in an ideal world, it's possible

The towers would solve the need for expansive farmland, and would help take some pressure off the constant deforestation. In my head, they would only be the 'boost' of sorts that would propel the local populations out of the situation they're in right now and into a better one that is easier to climb out of. (Such as in 'the boy who harnessed the wind').

The primary locations of the towers would be Africa, which is a tad problematic since there's quite a fair amount of violence and even 'small-scale' wars.....

And no, a trillion dollars is not that absurd a quantity of money. The US government spends almost 3/4's of that in a single year, just on the military. It's not an inordinate amount.

Kind of. Depends on how you look at it

.-.

That type of wealth can also snowball, if one is a careful shepherd. And then you'd have real money, not that $1TT isn't already enough to put a serious dent in the universe.
